subject: Productivity
title: Goodhart's Law
description: A quick win: understand Goodhart's Law.

hook.text: When a measure becomes a target, it ceases to be a good measure. Charles Goodhart said that in 1975.

buildup.text: Schools measured by test scores taught to the test. Hospitals measured by wait times rushed patients through.

discovery.text: Goodhart's Law explains why metrics gaming is universal. People optimize what's measured, not what matters.

twist.text: The solution isn't fewer metrics. It's measuring what you actually value, and rotating metrics to prevent gaming.

climax.text: Every organization that measures performance battles Goodhart's Law. Few even know its name.

punchline.text: Measure the wrong thing and people will deliver it perfectly.

quiz.question: What does Goodhart's Law state?
options: When a measure becomes a target it ceases to be a good measure
